title: Hey Riot, instead of nerfing duo lane Morde to make W castable in a solo lane.
body:
Why not keep it as it functions on live, except hit two birds with one stone? Current Morde is too reliant on support to function; meanwhile solo Morde entirely loses an ability. Both lose out very hard against kiting.

Why not have W be castable on enemy champions instead? Since {{champion:82}} is the master of metal and W's theme is magnets; and because his Q and R are single target abilities with no meaning to reach the target; give it the {{item:3745}} active with a small damage bonus.

If Morde auto attacks a target then Ws that target, it acts as a mini-displacement with minor damage. Sounds like a fair tradeoff since the other usage heals, gives mobility and deals a ton of damage. Wasn't that your thinking with {{champion:58}} 's usage of Fury? You get 3 powerful options with 50 fury, but you can only execute one.

Thoughts? :)

I'd like to remind you duo Morde is by no means weak and is sporting a 62% winrate, if people weren't bothering to try and lose games with solo lane Morde, his winrate would be much, MUCH higher.

He's slightly support reliant at the beginning of the game, the point where he can make the most out of his level advantage in lane. When he completes the Rylais + Trinity combo, he only has to hit a target once to keep him in place for the third hit, and is too bulky to be bursted down by assassins, which makes trying to assasinate him, or trying to not fight him head-on a win/win scenario.

 Duo lane Morde could use some nerfs to be honest.

I don't think you understand that the primary goal of the change is to nerf duo lane morde because he's hilariously overpowered right now.

Duo lane Mordekaiser is legitimately overpowered, while Solo lane Mordekaiser is, by comparison, very weak.

I'm not sure that that kind of ability that brings a target to Mordekaiser would be healthy. Sure, Mordekaiser is weak to kiting, but that is practically the only weakness that Mordekaiser has in a duo lane, and removing that weakness might make him obnoxiously overbearing when strong to the point where he can't be balanced.
